contextId.occurrenceNote: This probably refers to a place where trash and garbage were dumped and perhaps burned. Sitting in such a place was a sign of deep mourning. Alternate translation: "sat on the trash heap" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: sat down in the middle of ashes

contextId.occurrenceNote: "I would be resting with princes." In this phrase, the words "lying" and "resting" are a polite way of saying "no longer alive." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]])
contextId.glQuote: I would have been lying with princes

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a polite way of referring to dying. Alternate translation: "when he is dead and can be buried" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]])
This means for God to cause him to die. Alternate translation: "to crush me and let me die" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]])
Passing away represents dying. Alternate translation: "he dies" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]])
This refers to him dying. Alternate translation: "he will die" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]])
This is a polite way of saying that they die. Alternate translation: "they die peacefully" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]])
contextId.glQuote: they go down quietly to Sheol

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a polite way of saying that he dies. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]])
contextId.glQuote: the number of his months is cut off

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a polite way to say that they died. Alternate translation: "They both die and people bury them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]])
contextId.glQuote: They lie down alike in the dust

contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings are 1) this is an euphemism which means Job is saying may his wife sleep with another man or 2) it means she will become a slave and work for another man. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]])
contextId.glQuote: then let my wife grind grain for another

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that he would destroy him. Alternate translation: "destroy me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]])

This means that it is God who causes people to die, not people. Also, this can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "it is God and not humans who cause mighty people to die" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: mighty people will be taken away, but not by human hands

contextId.occurrenceNote: a euphemism for the place where people's spirits go when they die (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]])
